monster.name: Titania
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks, radiant

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Titania fails a saving throw she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Queen of the Archfey
trait.text: The magic of the feywild and the belief and adoration of the Seelie Court wraps itself around Titania and protects her from harm. Any attack roll that targets Titania is made with disadvantage. She is immune to all spells from the enchantment and illusion schools. Titania may also assume a fairy form at will. None of her statistics change, but she becomes small and gains a fly speed. Finally, Titania may add her Wisdom bonus to the damage of any cantrip she casts.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Titania is a 20th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 26, +18 to hit with spell attacks). Titania has the following druid spells prepared:
• Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, poison spray, resistance, thorn whip • 1st level (4 slots): charm person, cure wounds, faerie fire, healing word • 2nd level (3 slots): heat metal, hold person, moonbeam, spike growth • 3rd level (3 slots): call lightning, conjure animals, dispel magic, sleet storm • 4th level (3 slots): confusion, dominate beast, grasping vine • 5th level (3 slots): awaken, geas, scrying • 6th level (2 slots): conjure fey, heal, sunbeam • 7th level (2 slots): regenerate, reverse gravity • 8th level (1 slots): earthquake, feeblemind • 9th level (1 slots): foresight, shapechange

action.name: Crystal Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d4 + 6) piercing damage plus 22 (4d10) psychic damage. A creature damaged by the dagger must make a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or be restrained as their skin turns to crystal. The creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of their turn to end the effect. If the creature fails three saving throws, they are turned into a statue of pure crystal and slain. The dagger then magically returns to Titania's hand, provided that it is able to do so.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions
legendary.text: Titania can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Titania regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Crystal Dagger
legendary.text: Titania makes one crystal dagger attack.

legendary.name: Entangle
legendary.text: Titania casts entangle. Treat this like the first level spell of the same name, but Titania does not need to concentrate to maintain its effects.

legendary.name: Plant Stride
legendary.text: Titania may step into a plant or plant based creature within 5 feet of her and teleport to a plant or plant based creature within 300 feet.

monster.spells: Druidcraft, Poison Spray, Resistance, Thorn Whip, Charm Person, Cure Wounds, Faerie Fire, Healing Word, Heat Metal, Hold Person, Moonbeam, Spike Growth, Call Lightning, Conjure Animals, Dispel Magic, Sleet Storm, Confusion, Dominate Beast, Grasping Vine, Awaken, Geas, Scrying, Conjure Fey, Heal, Sunbeam, Regenerate, Reverse Gravity, Earthquake, Feeblemind, Foresight, Shapechange

monster.name: Oberon
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Oberon fails a saving throw she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Lord of Archers
trait.text: Oberon is the best archer in the Multiverse. He does not make ranged weapon attack rolls with disadvantage if he has an opponent within 5 feet. Oberon does make attack rolls with disadvantage when shooting beyond a bow's normal range. Oberon ignores cover when attacking with a bow. Finally, Oberon can roll all damage dice an additional time when determining the extra damage for a critical hit.

trait.name: Invisible
trait.text: Oberon is naturally invisible. This effect cannot be dispelled, though he can suppress it if he so chooses.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Oberon makes four attacks, any of which can be with either his warhammer or shortbow, or uses his Rays of Dawn twice.

action.name: Warhammer
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage or 9(1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 33 (6d10) psychic damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d6 + 6) piercing damage, plus 33 (6d10) force damage. If the target is within the normal range and is not behind total cover, Oberon's shot strikes unerringly.

action.name: Rays of Dawn
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) type damage plus 33 (6d10) radiant damage. Creatures damaged by the bow must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw. Creatures that fail are blinded and deafened until the end of their next turn.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions Oberon Can Take 3 Legendary Actions, Choosing From the Options Below
legendary.text: Oberon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Oberon regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

legendary.name: Rays of Dawn
legendary.text: Oberon makes one rays of dawn attack. Through the Forest. Oberon may move up to his speed. This move does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

legendary.name: Mark the Target
legendary.text: Oberon chooses one target he can see. All his attacks against that target inflict an additional 14 (4d6) damage until the end of his next turn.

monster.name: Queen of Air and Darkness
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks, cold, thunder

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the Queen of Air and Darkness fails a saving throw she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Invisible
trait.text: The Queen of Air and Darkness is naturally invisible. This effect cannot be dispelled, though she can suppress it if she so chooses.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The Queen of Air and Darkness can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. She takes 5 (1d10) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Queen of Air and Darkness makes four blighted touch attacks.

action.name: Blighted Touch
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 31 (4d10 + 9) psychic damage. A creature damaged by this attack must make a DC 24 Constitution saving throw. If they fail they cannot regain hit points until after they complete a long rest.

action.name: Wail of the Damned (recharges 5-6)
action.text: The Queen of Air and Darkness howls. The terrible sound rebounds from walls and seems to be coming from everywhere at once. Every creature within 120 feet of the Queen must make a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 45 (10d8) necrotic damage. A creature that failed the saving throw takes 45 (10d8) necrotic damage at the start of their next turn and must repeat the Wisdom saving throw. This continues until the creature succeeds on its saving throw, ending this effect on itself in a success.

reaction.name: The Void
reaction.text: If a creature within 30 feet of the Queen makes a successful saving throw, the Queen may use her reaction to force them to repeat the save with disadvantage. The creature must use the new save.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions Oberon Can Take 3 Legendary Actions, Choosing From the Options Below
legendary.text: The Queen of Air and Darkness can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Queen of Air and Darkness regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Shadow Walk
legendary.text: The Queen steps into a shadow and reappears in any shadow within 300 feet.

legendary.name: Swipe
legendary.text: The Queen makes one Blighted Touch attack.

legendary.name: Glimpse of the Eternal
legendary.text: The Queen of Air and Darkness reaches into the mind of a creature within 30 feet and reveals her face. The creature must make a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or be incapacitated until the end of their next turn.

monster.name: Ice, Lord of the Dark Hunt

trait.name: Unearthly Nimbleness
trait.text: Ice suffers no movement reduction from difficult terrain and treats impassable terrain as difficult terrain.

trait.name: Unearthly Hunter
trait.text: Ice scores a critical hit on a roll of a 19 or 20.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
Ice's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). Ice can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• At will: hunter's mark • 3/day each: jump, longstrider

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Ice makes three attacks, any of which can be with his soul stealing dagger or shortbow.

action.name: Soul Stealing Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by an attack with a soul stealing dagger must make a DC 16 Charisma saving throw. If they fail they are immediately slain, and Ice gains 10 temporary hit points and has advantage on melee attack rolls on his next turn.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) type damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

action.name: Make Them Bleed (special)
action.text: Ice makes a single soul stealing dagger attack against a creature within range. If he hits, the dagger inflicts maximum damage and the creature must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. If they fail, the creature takes one level of exhaustion. This ability recharges after Ice inflicts a critical hit.

action.name: Sudden Dash (Bonus Action)
action.text: Ice may move up to his full speed. This attack does not provoke opportunity attacks.

monster.name: Dragon Throne
monster.languages: can't speak, only communicates with its queen
monster.resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Immutable Form
trait.text: The Dragon Throne cannot be polymorphed against its will.

trait.name: Detect Thoughts
trait.text: The Dragon Throne is under a continuous detect thoughts spell. The dragon does not have to concentrate to maintain this spell.

trait.name: Spell Storing
trait.text: The Dragon Throne acts as a ring of spell turning for its occupant

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The Dragon Throne makes one bite and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage.

action.name: Cold Breath (recharge 5-6)
action.text: The Dragon Throne exhales an icy blast in a 50 foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) cold damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one.

action.name: For the Mistress (Bonus Action)
action.text: If Titania or the Queen of Air and Darkness takes damage within 30 feet of the Dragon Throne, the Throne may use its reaction to absorb the damage. Treat this as if the Throne had been the initial target of the attack. The Throne may use this ability before the queen makes a saving throw.

monster.description:
Do note that although one throne is made of ice and the other of solid shadow and smoke, the statistics for both thrones are the same.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 63 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Fey Noble

action.name: Rapier
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Misty Step (1/Day) (Bonus Action)
action.text: The fey noble casts misty step.

monster.description:
Fey nobles attend both courts. They are the primary players in the convoluted politics of both courts. Mortals find them beautiful, and they find mortals to be useful tools. Nearly every noble belongs to a clan, usually bound by blood. These clans form the basis of fey society and are always beholden to at least one fey lord. Marriages between different clans are supposed to create new alliances, but mostly just cause more chaos.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 64 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Fey Consort

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
Innate Spellcasting. The fey consort's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The fey consort can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• At will: friends, minor illusion

action.name: Dagger
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) type damage.

monster.description:
Fey consorts are neither combat veterans or skilled assassins, but they are some of the most dangerous members of either fey court. They are skilled manipulators and spies. They excel at gathering information and spotting corrupt individuals they can manipulate into giving the fey consorts what they want. Fey consorts avoid combat whenever possible, leaving that for the more boorish members of the court. Fey consorts are almost perversely fond of mortals, who are easy to manipulate.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 65 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Dark Hunter

trait.name: Slice the Heel
trait.text: If a dark hunter scores a critical hit, the creature must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced by half for 10 minutes.

action.name: Scimitar
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

action.name: Shortbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Howl of the Hunt (Bonus Action)
action.text: As a bonus action, the dark hunter may howl when it sees its prey. Every other dark hunter within 100 feet can hear the howl and may use their reaction to move up to their speed toward the prey.

monster.description:
The Unseelie Court is the home of the dark hunt. The dark hunt is a collection of fey and unique creatures that the Queen of Air and Darkness unleashes on anyone foolish enough to displease her, anger her, or if she's bored. The dark hunt gleefully seeks out its prey. Prizes and honor will be showered on the fey that kills the target of the hunt. Particularly painful or artistic kills will be given even greater honor. Competition amongst the dark hunt is extremely high, and most fey consider the race back to the Unseelie Court to deliver the target's head to be the most exciting part.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 65 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Baba Yaga
monster.save: Str +19, Dex +12, Con +16, Int +14, Wis +15, Cha +19
monster.resist: acid, cold, fire, lightning, radiant, thunder
monster.immune: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks, necrotic

trait.name: The First Witch
trait.text: Baba Yaga is one of the oldest beings in the multiverse. She was there when magic came into being and has studied its deepest secrets ever since. Baba Yaga knows every spell and can cast them at any time. She must expend spell slots as normal. Baba Yaga may cast any cantrip at will. She has four spell slots apiece for first through third level. She has three spell slots for each level from fourth through sixth. She has two spell slots for each level from seven to nine. Charisma is her usual spellcasting ability (spell save DC 27, +19 to hit with spell attacks) but she does know secrets of magic that allow her to use others. Baba Yaga's spells cannot be countered, but they can be blocked. For example, counterspell and dispel magic automatically fail, but shield and wall of force may still prove effective.

trait.name: Companions
trait.text: For a hermit that lives in a hut that moves from plane to plane, Baba Yaga has many companions. Three knights accompany her, each dressed in elaborate plate mail. The first is adorned in red (her Rising Dawn), the second in white (Midday Sun), and the third in black (Midnight Sky). Each of these knights will come to her aid if summoned, arriving by teleportation the round after she calls. These knights are death knights. In addition to the knights, Baba Yaga is also accompanied by her hound (a hell hound) and her cat (a displacer beast). Twenty skulls line the fence around her hut, and Baba Yaga can call all of the skulls at once. Treat the skulls as flameskulls which appear in any empty space within 300 feet of Baba Yaga the round after she calls. All the creatures appear and act on her initiative and can act immediately after appearing. Baba Yaga can call any or all of the creatures without using an action.

trait.name: Eternally Watching
trait.text: Baba Yaga is aware of any creature within 10 miles of her. She cannot be surprised and always goes first in combat.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
trait.text: If the Baba Yaga fails a saving throw she can choose to automatically succeed.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: Baba Yaga gains 50 hit points at the start of her turn. If a wish spell is used to stop this trait, it doesn't function at the start of Baba Yaga's next turn. Baba Yaga only dies if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Baba Yaga makes four iron claw attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Iron Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) slashing damage plus 44 (8d10) necrotic damage. A creature damaged by this attack must make a DC 23 Constitution saving throw. Creatures that fail are knocked prone and stunned until the end of Baba Yaga's next turn.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) piercing damage and the creature must make a DC 23 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 28 (8d6) piercing damage plus 28 (8d6) acid damage as Baba Yaga gnaws on them, and the creature's speed becomes 0 until Baba Yaga releases them. If they fail this saving throw by 5 or more, Baba Yaga's mouth magically grows as the creature magically shrinks, and they are swallowed. Swallowed creatures are deposited in Baba Yaga's stomach and torn apart by stomach acid and the spirits of her previous victims. They are slain and cannot be resurrected until Baba Yaga is slain.

action.name: Cackle (recharge 4-6)
action.text: Baba Yaga throws her head back and cackles madly. Every creature within 120 feet of her must make a DC 24 Wisdom saving throw, taking 110 (20d10) force damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If the creature is vulnerable to a type of damage, then the cackle damage becomes that type of damage in addition to being force damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions
legendary.text: Baba Yaga can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Baba Yaga regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Heart of Elements
legendary.text: Baba Yaga chooses one of the following types of energy: acid, cold, fire, lightning, radiant, or thunder. Until she uses this ability again, she is immune to that type of damage.

legendary.name: Iron Claw
legendary.text: Baba Yaga makes two iron claw attacks.

legendary.name: Teleport
legendary.text: Baba Yaga can teleport to any empty space within 300 feet. She may also choose to teleport one of her allies from their current location to an empty space within 300 feet.

monster.description:
The Seelie and Unseelie courts are the political power of the Feywild. But while many of the creatures that live in the plane look to them for leadership, they are not the oldest nor the most powerful beings in the Feywild. Baba Yaga is an ancient witch that has been called the mother of hags, the first night hag, the first witch and a thousand other titles besides. She is a wizened figure barely five feet tall, although severely hunched. Her hands are tipped with iron claws, and despite her appearance, she is devastatingly fast. Her eyes are black as coal, and when she smiles it is apparent that her teeth are made of sharpened stones. Baba Yaga smiles a lot. Baba Yaga is a mysterious figure within the Feywild. Sometimes helpful, and sometimes a cataclysmic force of nature. She does what she wishes when she wishes and very few creatures have the power to stop her.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 66 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Hound Archon

trait.name: Angelic Weapons
trait.text: The archon's weapon attacks are magical & deal an extra 2d8 radiant damage on a hit (included in the attack).

trait.name: Bloodscent
trait.text: The archon knows the direction & distance to any creature it has hit with a melee weapon attack in the past hour, if it is on the same plane of existence.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The archon has advantage on saving throws against spells & other magical effects.

trait.name: Planar Sentinel
trait.text: Creatures the archon can see within 60 feet cannot teleport or travel to other planes of existence.

action.name: Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) radiant damage.

action.name: Change Shape
action.text: The archon magically polymorphs into a canine beast with a challenge rating less than its own, any equipment it carries is absorbed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

monster.description:
These wingless angels have the heads of dogs & the bodies of muscled paladins. They serve as angelic guards & foot soldiers.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 68 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Jabberwocky

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the jabberwocky fails a saving throw it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Legendary Insanity
trait.text: The jabberwocky is completely nuts. The endless burbling has taken its toll on the poor creature, leaving a hollow shell of the creature it once was. The jabberwocky is immune to spells from the enchantment school.

trait.name: Limited Flight
trait.text: Calling the jabberwocky a clumsy flier is an immense understatement. Wings, neck, and limbs move in every direction at once and the jabberwocky doesn't fly as much as it falls in a variety of directions. The jabberwocky must start and finish its fly movement on ground. If it doesn't, the jabberwocky falls, taking 1d6 damage for every 10 feet fallen.

trait.name: Vorpal Vulnerability
trait.text: Vorpal swords score a critical hit on the jabberwocky on a roll of a 19 or 20.

trait.name: Burble
trait.text: The jabberwocky constantly talks, whispers, shouts, repeats terrible secrets it could not know, and weeps. The constant noise even affects the minds of those nearby, making communications and spellcasting difficult. Every creature within 120 feet of the jabberwocky is deafened. A spellcaster that attempts to cast a spell within 120 feet of the jabberwocky must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw. If they fail, the spell is ruined and countered, although the spell slot is still expended. On a success, the spell is cast as normal.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The jabberwocky makes two claw attacks and one burbling bite attack.

action.name: Burbling Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage. A creature damaged by this attack must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of the jabberwocky's next turn. If the creature rolls a natural 1 on the saving throw, they are knocked unconscious for 1 minute.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions
legendary.text: The jabberwocky can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The jabberwocky regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Tail
legendary.text: The jabberwocky makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Indignant Burble (2 Actions)
legendary.text: Something someone does insults the jabberwocky, who lets loose a short indignant shout. Every creature within 50 feet of the jabberwocky must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) thunder damage on a failed save.

legendary.name: Hop
legendary.text: The jabberwocky flaps its wings and pumps its limbs, taking to the air and landing in an empty space within 40 feet. This random amalgamation of limbs and wings is confusing for attackers and this move does not provoke opportunity attacks.

monster.description:
The jabberwocky is an enigma. It appears near either court seemingly at random, and sages among the fey listen to its constant burbling, trying to ascertain any meaning or portent in the insanity. The jabberwocky is a massive dragon shaped creature nearly thirty feet in length. It is a gangly mishmash of limbs, with a head far too large for its neck. Its eyes constantly wander, never looking at anything for very long and its heavy jaws constantly move. The jabberwocky has small wings that are barely able to lift its massive body off the ground. Little is known about the history of the jabberwocky. Some sages think it to be a type of dragon, and others a mutilated fiend or celestial. No one really knows. Sages even argue if there is one jabberwocky or if it is a species of dragon native to the Feywild. The only sure thing is that the jabberwocky isn't telling anyone.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 69 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Lantern Archon
monster.immune: lightning, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The archon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends it's turn inside an object

trait.name: Variable Illumination
trait.text: The archon sheds bright light in a 5- to 20- foot radius and dim light for the same radius beyond that. It can alter these as a bonus action.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
Innate Spellcasting. The archon's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The archon can innately cast the following spells, requiring only vocal components:
• At will: cure wounds, sacred flame

action.name: Smite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) radiant damage and the target becomes visible if it was invisible. Attack rolls against the target are made with advantage until the end of the archon's next turn.

monster.description:
These wispy entities appear to be harmless balls of floating light to untrained observers. Yet, their ephemeral and benign appearance hides their true natures. They are the departed spirits of great warriors, tasked by the gods with protecting their people.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 70 (Homebrew)

monster.name: Spell Seeker
monster.languages: understands Infernal but can't speak it

trait.name: Magic Hunter
trait.text: If the Spell Seeker sees a spell cast within 60 feet of it, the Spell Seeker can use its reaction to mark the caster. While marked, the Spell Seeker's Drain Bite attack deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage to the marked target on a hit. In addition, the spell seeker has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Wisdom (Survival) checks to track the marked creature. The Spell Seeker can only mark one target at a time.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The spell seeker makes two claw attacks. Claw. Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Drain Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft. one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) necrotic damage and the spell seeker regains hit points equal to half the damage done to the target, rounded down.

reaction.name: Pounce
reaction.text: When the spell seeker can make an attack of opportunity, it can instead use its reaction to attempt to grapple the creature (escape DC 13).

monster.description:
These fiendish creatures resemble hairless pale-white dogs but with elongated legs. Being experts at following magical trails left behind by arcane uses, they are frequently used by both bounty hunters to track down unlawful mages and by Devils who are looking for someone to enslave. Once one of these creatures mark a target, they will stop at almost nothing until they catch their quarry.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 70 (Homebrew)
